description:
I have a system, where, when I type:
nova hypervisor-show <hypervisor mame> I get:

vcpus                     | 32
vcpus_used                | 38

This is wired to have used value bigger then Total value
title: Used VCPU's can show bigger value than Total VCPU's in nova hypervisor-show

comments.content:
I have a system, where, when I type:
nova hypervisor-show <hypervisor mame> I get:

vcpus                     | 32
vcpus_used                | 38

This is wired to have used value bigger then Total value
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ajeain

comments.content: Looks like you have some vcpu quotas that are left hanging around, which is probably caused by an instance delete error or something similar.  Did you get any errors before this?  Which distro and OpenStack version are you using?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~thang-pham

comments.content:
I don't know which errors you refer to. Can you point me to the relevant error log file? I can always attach it.
The version is Iceouse:
# rpm -qa |grep openstack-nova
openstack-nova-api-2014.1-6.el7ost.noarch
openstack-nova-common-2014.1-6.el7ost.noarch
openstack-nova-cert-2014.1-6.el7ost.noarch
openstack-nova-novncproxy-2014.1-6.el7ost.noarch
openstack-nova-common-2014.1-3.el7ost.noarch
openstack-nova-cert-2014.1-3.el7ost.noarch
openstack-nova-conductor-2014.1-6.el7ost.noarch
openstack-nova-console-2014.1-6.el7ost.noarch
openstack-nova-scheduler-2014.1-3.el7ost.noarch
openstack-nova-scheduler-2014.1-6.el7ost.noarch
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ajeain

comments.content: Look in nova-api or nova-cpu logs for ERROR messages.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~thang-pham

comments.content:
I have 400MB of nova-api.log....
which errors you want me to grep?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ajeain

comments.content: This is OK. You can overcommit the VCPUs. Refer to CoreFilter if you don't want to do this, or you want to specify a ratio of vcpus over commits.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~wangjian011

comments.content: Because we default to overcommit, this is possible. There is a UX feature that would expose total with the scaling factor.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
